definition: lit. the whole nest came out (to fight us)/a turnout in full force (of a gang of villains)
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
surname Chao
nest
the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
to turn out in force ready to attack (idiom)

sentences.english: A rumbling sound started, and the rats poured out from all of the houses.
sentences.chinese: 传来一阵隆隆声，老鼠从房子里倾巢而出。

sentences.english: The whole city turned out to cheer the Pope .
sentences.chinese: 全城居民倾巢而出欢迎教皇。

sentences.english: Bigwigs on both sides were also in full-gush mode.
Protester Tareq Saeed was among the demonstrators out in force Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者塔里克赛义德是其中倾巢出动周四示威者。

sentences.english: The bandits turned out in full strength.
We have turned out in full force, wishing to fulfill the task.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经倾巢出动了，但愿能够完成好这项任务。

definition: the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
to invade one's territory
annihilated/capsized
lit. when the nest is upset no egg is left intact (idiom)/fig. when one falls in disgrace the whole family is doomed
pinyin: fu4 chao2 zhi1 xia4 wu2 wan2 luan3

definition: to make a surprise attack/to pounce on (an enemy)
lit. a thunder of dragons without a head/fig. a group lacking a leader
to take advantage of sb's misfortune/to loot
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
attack from two sides/pincer movement/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
lit. without the lips, the teeth feel the cold (idiom); fig. intimately interdependent
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
to coordinate outside and inside offensives (idiom)/(fig.) to act together
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
